original: Lindberg, Per Jakob Helmer, kontorschef, Göteborg, f. 22/5/80 i Gävle av J. L. o. Mathilda Frommelin. G. 03 m. Ester Sjödin. Barn: Bengt f. 04, överläk. v. Sahlgr. sjukh., Gbg, Margit 05, g. m. civ:ing. Hadar Kvarn-sjö, Gbg, Bertil 08, kyrkoadj., Kristinehamn, Folke 11, notarie, länsst., Gbg, Kurt-Olov (Olle) 18, fil. mag., Uppsala. — Stud. v. Gävle borgarsk. o. h. handelsinst. samt v. handelshög-sk. Anst. i firma B. G. Kronberg i Gävle 97-00, Akerson & Co. där 00-02 samt P. Äberg & Co. där 02-04, kor-resp. h. Nordström & Tinggren i Gbg 04-13, _ kont rchef där sed. 14. Varit rev. i hälsovmdn, sjukhusdirekt. o. Örgryte fören. mot tbc, led. av polis-kolleg. o. taxmd, ordf. i styr. f. Gårda - barnh., Gbgs Veckotidn., Betlehems-kyrkans miss :förs., styr :led. i Sv. miss :förb. m. m. Resor t. Engl. 12 o. 25, Tyskl. o. Schv^eiz 20, Frankr. 25. Hobby: språk.
translated:
Lindberg, Per Jakob Helmer, office manager, Gothenburg, born on May 22, 1880 in Gävle to J. L. and Mathilda Frommelin. Married in 1903 to Ester Sjödin. Children: Bengt, born in 1904, senior physician at Sahlgreen Hospital in Gothenburg, Margit, born in 1905, married to civil engineer Hadar Kvarnsjö in Gothenburg, Bertil, born in 1908, church assistant in Kristinehamn, Folke, born in 1911, clerk at the county court in Gothenburg, Kurt-Olov (Olle), born in 1918, graduated with a degree in philosophy from Uppsala. 

Studied at Gävle Business School and Trade School, as well as at the Business School. Employed at B. G. Kronberg & Co. in Gävle from 1897 to 1900, Akerson & Co. from 1900 to 1902, and P. Äberg & Co. from 1902 to 1904. Correspondent at Nordström & Tinggren in Gothenburg from 1904 to 1913, and office manager since 1914. Has been a reviewer in health care, hospital director, and member of the Örgryte Association against tuberculosis. Also a member of the Police Board and Tax Board, chairman of the board for Gårda Children's Home, Gothenburg Weekly Newspaper, Bethlehem Church Mission Congregation, and board member of the Swedish Missionary Association, among others. Traveled to England in 1912 and 1925, Germany and Switzerland in 1920, and France in 1925. Hobby: languages.
